fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Trade, Competition, Energy, Environment, Climate Action
eu_initiatives:
Policies and regulatory issues affecting the nitrogen fertiliser sector, including agriculture, chemicals, environment, energy, climate change and trade policy areas. 
Current priority areas are the EU (Greenhouse Gas) Emissions Trading System (Phase 4 from 2021-2030), new Fertilizer Regulation (to replace EC 2003/2003) and the Industrial Emissions Directive (proposals for and development of relevant Best Available Techniques Reference Documents).
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
EU - Fertilizers Europe 
UK - Chemicals Industries Association, Agricultural Industries Confederation
goals__remit: Manufacture and supply of nitrogen fertiliser products and related industrial chemicals.
relevant_communication: Direct engagement with MEPs, assistants and officials on Emissions Trading System and Fertilizer Regulation developments (for example, meetings with MEPs in Brussels, Strasbourg and in their constituencies, as well as attendance at relevant group meetings).
